content_items.title: Story Thread: Tame The Claw (Harness + Cockpit)
content_items.content:
1/ Stop running agents bareback.

OpenClaw is a beast: fast, powerful, chaotic at scale.

2/ The failure mode isn’t “bad prompts.”
It’s losing the thread:
- what’s done?
- what’s blocked?
- what’s next?
- what decision is pending?

3/ OrgX is the harness + armor:
Mission Control (initiative -> workstream -> milestone -> task)
+ a next-up queue
+ decision checkpoints.

4/ Then you drive like ops.
You check outputs, approve the decision, press continue, and the run keeps moving.

5/ Proof: Mission Control inside OpenClaw.

6/ Install in one line:
openclaw plugins install @useorgx/openclaw-plugin

7/ Try it: https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=x&utm_medium=thread&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=tame_the_claw

content_items.title: Story Thread: OpenClaw Hires The OrgX Crew
content_items.content:
1/ OpenClaw hired OrgX.
Not a tool. A crew.

2/ Launch Captain:
Turns “ship this” into a sequence and keeps the run moving.

3/ Control Tower:
The cockpit view: what’s active, blocked, and next.

4/ Engineering Autopilot:
Executes tasks with quality gates + checkpoints.

5/ Pipeline Intelligence:
Routes models + watches budget (so you don’t burn tokens blindly).

6/ The point:
You stop holding coordination in your head.
You press continue.

7/ Install + connect: https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=x&utm_medium=thread&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=meet_the_crew

content_items.title: Mechanic Thread: The Continue Button Is The Product
content_items.media_brief: Tweet 1: attach docs/launch/assets/mission-control-2026-02-09.gif. Tweet 4: optionally attach a run-control screenshot (pause/resume/checkpoint/rollback).
content_items.content:
1/ The product isn’t the agent.
It’s the continue button.

2/ If you can’t reliably answer “what’s next?”, your runs will always feel like babysitting.

3/ OrgX gives you the missing control plane:
- next-up queue (dependency-aware)
- decisions + approvals
- run controls (pause/resume/cancel/checkpoint/rollback)
- quality gates + model routing
- live dashboard + activity stream

4/ Workflow:
queue -> run -> checkpoint -> approve -> continue -> ship.

5/ Install:
openclaw plugins install @useorgx/openclaw-plugin

6/ See the integration: https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=x&utm_medium=thread&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=press_continue

content_items.title: Launch Announcement Thread
content_items.content:
1/ Launching: OrgX Integration for OpenClaw. Mission Control for your agents: orchestration, quality gates, model routing, and a live dashboard inside OpenClaw.

2/ If you have ever run more than one agent, you know the failure mode: you lose the thread. What's done? What's blocked? What's next?

3/ OrgX adds a hierarchy view (initiative -> workstream -> milestone -> task), a next-up queue, and a real-time activity stream, so execution stays legible.

4/ Install in one line:
openclaw plugins install @useorgx/openclaw-plugin

5/ Then open:
http://127.0.0.1:18789/orgx/live
and click Connect OrgX (browser pairing recommended, manual key fallback supported).

6/ Try it here: https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=x&utm_medium=thread&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=launch_announcement

content_items.title: Value Proposition Thread
content_items.content:
1/ Your agents do not need more prompting. They need guardrails + coordination.

2/ Agent orchestration (in practice) is: decisions, dependencies, budgets, quality thresholds, and reliable reporting.

3/ The OrgX OpenClaw plugin gives you:
- Mission Control (initiative -> workstream -> milestone -> task)
- Next-up queue (dependency-aware)
- Live activity + sessions
- Spawn checks (quality gate)
- Model tier routing
- Offline-safe outbox replay

4/ Result: you spend less time babysitting runs and more time shipping.

5/ See the integration: https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=x&utm_medium=thread&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=value_prop

content_items.title: Build In Public Thread
content_items.content:
1/ Build in public: shipping the OrgX OpenClaw plugin this week.

2/ The hard parts weren't the UI. It was reliability: auth/pairing, outbox replay, live streaming, and keeping the control plane consistent.

3/ One example: Mission Control looked stuck at 0% because it relied on a stale health field. We fixed it to compute completion from task/milestone/workstream status.

4/ Another: the Codex dispatch job used duplicated HTTP logic. We refactored to inject a shared OrgXClient and added CI coverage for it.

5/ If you're building agent workflows and want something that feels like real operations: try it. https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=x&utm_medium=thread&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=build_in_public

content_items.title: Demo Walkthrough Thread
content_items.content:
1/ 60 seconds to value with the OrgX OpenClaw plugin.

2/ Install:
openclaw plugins install @useorgx/openclaw-plugin

3/ Open Mission Control inside OpenClaw:
http://127.0.0.1:18789/orgx/live

4/ Click Connect OrgX and approve pairing at useorgx.com.

5/ Add provider keys (BYOK) for OpenAI/Anthropic/OpenRouter (or set env vars).

6/ Launch an agent and watch live sessions + activity update.

7/ Switch to Mission Control: pick the next-up task and run auto-continue to execute through the dependency chain.

8/ Get started: https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=x&utm_medium=thread&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=demo_walkthrough

content_items.title: Dev.to Article Draft
content_items.content:
# Mission Control for OpenClaw Agents: the OrgX Integration

If you are experimenting with agentic workflows, you quickly hit the same wall: execution becomes hard to reason about. You can launch agents, but you cannot easily answer: what is done, what is blocked, what is next, and what decisions are pending?

OrgX is built to make agent execution legible. The OpenClaw plugin brings that into your local OpenClaw instance: orchestration, quality gates, model routing, and a live Mission Control dashboard.

## What you get
- Mission Control: Initiative -> Workstream -> Milestone -> Task
- Dependency-aware next-up queue
- Live sessions + activity stream
- Spawn checks (quality gate) + model tier routing
- Offline-safe reporting with outbox replay

## Install + connect
1. Install:
   openclaw plugins install @useorgx/openclaw-plugin
2. Open:
   http://127.0.0.1:18789/orgx/live
3. Click Connect OrgX and approve pairing at useorgx.com.

## Why this matters
When you can see the work, you can improve the system. Mission Control turns agent runs into something closer to operations: a backlog, a control plane, and an audit trail of what happened and why.

## Next steps
If you want to try it, start here: https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw?utm_source=devto&utm_medium=article&utm_campaign=openclaw_launch&utm_content=devto_article

Feedback welcome. If you run into anything confusing, tell us what you expected and what you saw.

OrgX for OpenClaw = harness + cockpit for your agents.

Install:

content_items.title: X Ads Variant B (Press Continue)

content_items.content:
Press continue. The work keeps going.

OrgX for OpenClaw adds:
next-up queue + decisions + quality gates + live dashboard.

Try it in 60 seconds.
